titleStmt.title: Digital Edition of Glaser Abklatsch ID: AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-P-481
AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-P-481

item.term: Early first millennium to the fourth century BC (predominance of Saba)
Fourth to first centuries BC (predominance of Qataban and Hadramawt, and their alliance with Main)
First century BC to early second century AD (alliances between the tribes of the high plateau and the ASA kingdoms)
Late second to late third centuries AD (wars among the Himyar, Saba and Hadramawt)
Fourth to sixth centuries AD (unification of Yemen under Himyarite rule)
It corresponds to the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans with sub-periods I-IV
First sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Third sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Fourth sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Fourth sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans

graphic.desc: By kind permission of British Museum

1.Thus have brought to pass and decreed Taʾ- 2.lab, Lord of Makhliyyum, and Saʿdab 3.[and] Yuḥibbuʾīl of the lineage of Sukhaymum 4.[and] their tribe of the town of Birrān and 5.Turʿat and ʾAshraʿ. And they carried out the winnowing of the entire cultivated 6.land of the town of Birrān so that they might set in order and 7.arranged the grazing land: every flock(?) and grassy 8.area(?) and grazing plot of the mountain [...] 9.sustained(?) for him all of the small livestock, as 10.[... ...] the grazing land: all of its 11.[...] because they have granted them 12.their grazing land, (i.e.) their lords of the li- 13.neage of Sukhaymum.

Thus have brought to pass and decreed Taʾ-
lab, Lord of Makhliyyum, and Saʿdab
and Yuḥibbuʾīl of the lineage of Sukhaymum
and their tribe of the town of Birrān and
Turʿat and ʾAshraʿ. And they carried out the winnowing of the entire cultivated
land of the town of Birrān so that they might set in order and
arranged the grazing land: every flock? and grassy
area? and grazing plot of the mountain ...
sustained? for him all of the small livestock, as
the grazing land: all of its
... because they have granted them
their grazing land, i.e. their lords of the li-
neage of Sukhaymum.

Thus have brought to pass and decreed Taʾ-
lab, Lord of Makhliyyum, and Saʿdab
and Yuḥibbuʾīl of the lineage of Sukhaymum
and their tribe of the town of Birrān and

land of the town of Birrān so that they might set in order and
arranged the grazing land: every flock? and grassy
area? and grazing plot of the mountain ...
sustained? for him all of the small livestock, as
the grazing land: all of its
... because they have granted them
their grazing land, i.e. their lords of the li-
neage of Sukhaymum.

Thus have brought to pass and decreed Taʾ-
lab, Lord of Makhliyyum, and Saʿdab

arranged the grazing land: every flock? and grassy

sustained? for him all of the small livestock, as
the grazing land: all of its
... because they have granted them
their grazing land, i.e. their lords of the li-
neage of Sukhaymum.
